mixed-citation.article-title: The pharciceratid ammonoids from the Roteisenstein Formation of Dillenburg (Cephalopoda, Ammonoidea)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Synpharciceras plurilobatum Petter, 1959
, by original designation.

Synpharciceratinae with discoidal to thinly pachyconic, subevolute juvenile stage, whorl profile depressed. Adult stage subinvolute to involute with compressed whorl profile; WER moderate to high. Flanks and venter continuously rounded, without ventrolateral grooves. E 1 lobe funnel or bell-shaped, E2, L and up to 12 narrow and deep U lobes, lanceolate or pointed with decreasing size towards the umbilicus.
